## prefers-reduced-motion: Sometimes less movement is more

[<img src="https://web-dev.imgix.net/image/admin/8PLpVmFef6mj72MVWeiN.jpg?auto=format&amp;fit=crop&amp;h=40&amp;w=40" alt="Thomas Steiner" class="w-author__image w-author__image--small" sizes="(min-width: 40px) 40px, calc(100vw - 48px)" srcset="

Updated: Dec 10, 2019

<a href="/prefers-reduced-motion/" class="w-card-base__link"></a>

The prefers-reduced-motion media query detects whether the user has requested the operating system to minimize the amount of animation or motion it uses.

Intersection Observer v2 adds the capability to not only observe intersections per se, but to also detect if the intersecting element was visible at the time of intersection.

<span class="w-author__name"><a href="/authors/petelepage/" class="w-author__name-link">Pete LePage</a></span>

Updated: Feb 23, 2021

<a href="/get-installed-related-apps/" class="w-card-base__link"></a>

The \`getInstalledRelatedApps()\` method allows your website to check whether your iOS/Android/desktop app or PWA is installed on a user's device.

Updated: Feb 23, 2021

<a href="/wake-lock/" class="w-card-base__link"></a>

The Screen Wake Lock API provides a way to prevent devices from dimming or locking the screen when an application needs to keep running.
